page.title: 01OTMOOR - AN OVERVIEW
page.content: The area of countryside that comprises this Block, to the southeast of the village of Charlton-on-Otmoor in Oxfordshire, maybe described as unique in this part of the County.Almost totally flat,it owes its origin to the fact that it formed an ancient lakebed in past geological times and therefore the soils of the area are of a clay nature.Known for its solitude and its wetness very few inhabitants live on the moor.It is a haven for wildlife, particularly birds who use the wetlands as a resting point on flights between the Severn Estuary and the Wash.The Romans successfully crossed the moor when they constructed a road linking Alchester and Dorchester-on-Thames but the area remained an unhealthy marshland until the early 1800's when enclosure and drainage projects were initiated to improve the land.
